I oddly remember wanting this back in like .20, but then chucking it up to "it'll be eventually added", category, but it not got added, nothing even close got implemented. So I'm now re-requesting it.

KSP should have a computer "space race" option, where a computer player will automatically perform launches (based on preset settings)(Basically it would be like a DMP game where two players exist within the same universe but yet do not constantly interact).

The computer would be under its own science and funding. However with science, the rule is with every complete tier (in the normal tech tree)(a whole vertical row), the other player gets that tier auto unlocked as well, which is nice in the beginning but you have to manage your own science later on.

As for gaining money (funding), there would be a set of "pool missions" where both players can take them on (such as satalite deployment, kerbal rescues, probe/rover deployment, etc etc)(compatible with ConteactPacks), however achievement missions (such as enter orbit, achieve X altitude/speed, etc) would remain for both players, and the other couldn't accept/complete the contract before the other.

"Victory", would also be preset. Victory can be anything, such as landing on the Mun, Duna or capturing an asteroid, or crashing into X body. It would also be set as to whether or not the game would end or continue after victory has been achieved or failed. It could also be possible to achieve several objectives, such as first on the moon then land on Duna, then whatever.

It would be even more awesome if you could have more than 2 computers, you could have more than 1, you could have 8 (there will be a maximum).

There would be some form of a launch mechanic, I'd say (if KerbalKonstructs/KerbinSide or KCT isn't installed) that when the computer wants to launch a vehicle, that for one Kerbin hour that the player must occupy their time, they can time warp or (what's preferred) switch over to another mission such as a rover or colony mission and collect science/funds by completing missions.

I'd like to see ts idea mod compatible, with these mods-

KCT

KerbalKonstructs

KerbinSide

ContractPacks

RSS

and more...

Ofc this is a major task for someone to take up, but it's an age old task which has been needed to be done since the days of old.

So who's up to it? (I know I mentioned making a mod a while back, but it's 1000000000000000 times harder than I expected and that tiny massive mod may take years to even get .01 out, so no, I can't do this. We need a mod expert)
Would anyone like to take this up?

Some people seem to approve, but is anyone going to make this happen?

As far as I remember, there has never been a request for a complex mod that has been picked up by a modder and was then realized. People make mods because they think of a feature that they want to have in the game and at some point want it to be in the game so badly that they just end up adding it themselves, some even learning to mod just to make it happen. And even that is often not enough motivation to see it through to an end, as you can see by how many mods get eventually abandoned. So the chance of somebody getting motivated enough for an idea that isn't his own is pretty slim; or to look at it from a different perspective, all the people who are skilled enough to make something like this and have enough motivation to keep going will be too busy realizing their own ideas.

Long talk short, if you really want it to happen, you will probably have to pick up modding and make it happen.
